Class GridUnitExtension

A MarkupExtension which is being used by the toolkit to align visual elements in a grid-like fashion. The idea is that each control uses margins, paddings, sizes, etc. which can be fit into grid cells. Thus, when positioned correctly, all controls will have a unified appearance.

This extension provides unified values, multiplied with the bounds of a single grid cell. See the example for details.

Namespace: Celestial.UIToolkit.Xaml

Syntax
public class GridUnitExtension : MarkupExtension
Examples

1gu = 1 grid unit(s) -> Multiplier = 1 2gu = 2 grid unit(s) -> Multiplier = 2

Thus, for a GridCellSize of 4:

1gu = 4 * 1 = 4 2gu = 4 * 2 = 8 3gu = 4 * 3 = 12 ...

In XAML, the extension can be used like this: Width="{c:GridUnit 1.0}" Margin="{c:GridUnit 3}" Margin="{c:GridUnit '3,0'}" Margin="{c:GridUnit '3,0,2,0'}"

Properties

| Improve this Doc View Source

DefaultGridCellSize

Gets or sets the default value of a single grid unit. This value equals the width and height of a single cell in the fictional grid.

Declaration
public static double DefaultGridCellSize { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
Double
| Improve this Doc View Source

GridCellSize

Gets the value of a single grid unit. This value equals the width and height of a single cell in the fictional grid. By default, this returns the value of the static DefaultGridCellSize property. By setting this property, you can override this default value for specific cases.

Declaration
public double GridCellSize { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
Double
| Improve this Doc View Source

MultiplierString

Gets or sets the value with which the GridCellSize will be multiplied, as string. Depending on the target property type, different formats will be allowed.

For numeric targets (Double, Int32, ...), a numeric string is valid, e.g. "0", "1.3", ...

For 4-way targets like Thickness, the above is allowed, in addition to the following example formats: "1 2", "4.4 1 2 0", ...

Declaration
[ConstructorArgument("multiplierString")]
public string MultiplierString { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
String
| Improve this Doc View Source

MultiplyWithDip

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the calculation of the final value should include a multiplication with the device independent pixel multiplier. This is false, by default, since most conversion targets (like Thickness) do the calculation by themselves.

Declaration
public bool MultiplyWithDip { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
Boolean
| Improve this Doc View Source

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

ProvideValue(IServiceProvider)

Multiplies the MultiplierString with the GridCellSize, converts it to device independent pixels and finally returns that result.

Declaration
public override object ProvideValue(IServiceProvider serviceProvider)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IServiceProvider serviceProvider

An IServiceProvider to be used. Can be null.
Returns
Type Description
Object

The Double which is the result of the grid unit multiplication.
